snippet: States that happily accepted stimulus money to pay for existing employees are laying off those workers in droves. Putting them back to work now depends on Congress.
abstract: Editorial warns that many states across the country that happily accepted stimulus money to pay for existing employees are laying off workers now that those funds have dried up; criticizes Republican lawmakers for blocking vital legislation to bolster cash-strapped states and allow them to retain crucial government employees, and Mitt Romney for supporting their position.
lead_paragraph: States that happily accepted stimulus money to pay for existing employees are laying off those workers in droves. Putting them back to work now depends on Congress.

headline.print_headline: The Beleaguered Middle Class: As austerity bites, pink slips roll in for teachers and cops
